Trial_Design.evidence: We randomly divided 94 patients into two treatment groups.

Intervention.evidence: percutaneous repetitive sclerotherapy using polidocanol (Group 1) with those with intralesional excision (extended curettage with a high-speed burr) and bone grafting (Group 2)

Objective.evidence: We therefore compared the healing rates and functional scores in patients having percutaneous repetitive sclerotherapy using polidocanol (Group 1) with those with intralesional excision (extended curettage with a high-speed burr) and bone grafting (Group 2) for treatment of aneurysmal bone cyst.

Method_Outcome.evidence: We assessed healing rates (primary outcome measure), pain relief, time to healing and recurrence, hospital stay, and the Enneking functional score.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: We randomly divided 94 patients into two treatment groups.

Number_Randomised.evidence: We randomly divided 94 patients into two treatment groups.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Forty-five patients from Group 1 and 46 from Group 2 were available for study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At last followup, 93.3% in Group 1 and 84.8% in Group 2 had achieved healing.

Harms.evidence: Complications in Group 1 were minor and resolved. In Group 2, three patients had deep infections and five had superficial infections, and two had growth disturbances.
